result.execSummary:
The defendant Alicia A Remley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Must appear at probation today.
Concurrent with: 13CF267 and 14CF57

miscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/cost to be paid to the Clerk of Courts Office- 60 days to pay or set up payment plan. Failure to do so will be warrant.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.

Cannot vote until civil rights are restored. 
If not a US Citizen, may face deportation.
Attorney Brian Smestad to follow up regarding sentence credit.

timeConds.notes:
Additional banked jail time. The stay will be lifted if the Teen Focus program is not successfully completed.
**Per Court Order on 5/21/18, Defendant to serve conditional jail time through March 20, 2019.  Subject to Work Release.  NOT subject to Good Time.  May serve time in any other County as long as there is no cost to Polk County.**

CASES:  13CF267, 14CF85, 14CF57. Defendant Alicia A Remley in court with attorney Brian Thomas Smestad.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  BJM-clerk 11:48 AM  BSmestad - corrections to PSI.   

13CF267:  w/h sent.  3 yrs prob- must appear today, 90 days banked jail time to be used by agent if necessary, Absolute Sobriety. no illegal substances, must complete Teen Focus prog, $290.60 fine/costs - 25 hrs CS per year, total 75 hrs during prob - may complete in MN.  

14CF57:  w/h sent. 3 yrs prob- must appear today- concurrent with 13CF267, 90 day add'l banked jail time, CS concurrent w/13CF267.  $290.60 fine/costs.

14CF85:  w/h sent. 4 yrs prob-  must appear today- concurrent with13CF267 and 14CF57. 25 add'l hrs of CS, 1 yr add'l banked jail time - the stay will be lifted if Teen Focus prog is not successfully completed.  $290.60 fine/costs.
